I tried using Ookla to confirm it was just me, but I was getting full download speeds.  Then Ookla started having connection issues.  Then when I finally connected to it again, it was getting notices of potential problems from big companies
Then when I went to a website that monitors websites for either downtime or complaints of downtime, a lot of big companies were getting spikes.
Companies like Reddit, Crunchyroll, Amazon, etc.
Might be another DDoS on DNS.  Been a while too.
Ugh... now I'M the one who needs coffee... and I don't have any :ptv-unimpressed:

:ptv-pouty:
DDOS on DNS you say?
I was reading about it on a site that miraculously wasn't down.  Apparently this happened ~2.5 years back
Yeah I think I heard of that incident
More or less someone wanted extra brownie points and decided to DDoS the backbone of the internet.  They didn't hate one site, they hated ALL the sites xD
If you're suspicion is right, this won't be the last we've hear of this incident now
Usually the DNS backbone get's used for DDOS attacks, not as the target
Ever heard of DNS amplification
Nope

You send a DNS request with a field called response size of something of that sort. But you spoof the IP address of the sender to be your target instead of you. Then the DNS replies to the alleged sender with the requested response. And DNS is powerfull.
It's like the entire internet wants to talk to you at once
The last attack of this nature I heard about had several Gigabytes/sek of bandwidth
That was a report by Cloudflare
Luckily Newegg was down, so I was able to tentatively build a computer xD
